Portugal 2-2 Turkey - Gil Martins & Francisco Neto score in the 2025 Euro U19 qualifiers
arts.sum: Portugal overturned a 2-0 deficit to earn a 2-2 draw against Turkey in their opening match in the 2025 UEFA European U19 Championship qualifiers. H√ºseyin Ert√ºrk converted a penalty in the 40th minute and Efe Korkut produced a calm finish past Gon√ßalo Ribeiro two minutes into the second half. Portugal immediately responded as Ol√≠vio Tom√© assisted Gil Martins but it was Turkey who looked more likely to add to their lead. They couldn't convert however, Tom√©'s spilled cross fired home by substitute Francisco Neto in the 80th minute. Portugal 2-2 Turkey Portugal created the opening two opportunities in Connah's Quay, Ol√≠vio Tom√© firing over the bar and Eduardo Felic√≠ssimo‚Äôs shot saved by Doƒüukan Demir. A long ball wasn‚Äôt dealt with in the 40th minute which saw Gon√ßalo Ribeiro come off his line and take out H√ºseyin Ert√ºrk. The striker stepped up and sent Ribeiro the wrong way from the penalty spot. Filipe Ramos brought on Diogo Lob√£o and Gabriel Silva at the break but two minutes later Turkey made it 2-0. Another breakdown in defence allowed Emre G√∂kay to send Efe Korkut clear and he produced a calm finish past Ribeiro. Portugal immediately reduced the deficit, a nice pass from Ol√≠vio Tom√© finding Gil Martins who beat Demir from close range. Turkey went close to restoring their two-goal advantage on three occasions, the first when Emirhan Arkutcu‚Äôs long free kick was tipped off the bar by Ribeiro. Mertcan Ayhan fired over the bar from point blank range and Emre G√∂kay tested the goalkeeper with another set piece. Tom√© gave Gabriel Silva a chance that he fired wide and then missed an opportunity of his own, but he stayed in the action and played a key role in the 80th minute equaliser. Tom√© got to the byline and saw his cross spilled by Demir, substitute Francisco Neto converting from close range. The result leaves Filipe Ramos‚Äô side with a point in Group 7 where the winners qualift for the 2025 UEFA European U19 Championship in Romania. Portugal take on hosts Wales on Saturday and end the group against England on Tuesday.

arts.ttl: Portugal 2-0 Hungary - Gil Neves & An√≠sio Cabral on target in the Euro U17 qualifiers
arts.sum: Portugal beat Hungary 2-0 in Braga to take an early advantage in the 2025 Euro U17 Championship qualifiers. Gil Neves opened the scoring in the 38th minute and An√≠sio Cabral doubled the lead in the 60th minute when he drew M√°rk Balogh out of his box and beat the stranded goalkeeper. Benj√°min G√≥lik hit the bar but Hungary fashioned just two shots, Portugal ending the game in the ascendancy with Jo√£o Arag√£o hitting the post. Bino Ma√ßaes‚Äô side now prepare for Netherlands and Serbia, top spot in group A4 required for a spot in the 2025 UEFA European U17 Championship. Portugal 2-0 Hungary Portugal got on top early at Cidade Desportiva do SC Braga, An√≠sio Cabral and Mateus Mide with early shots blocked and Duarte Cunha firing wide from a tight angle. Cunha‚Äôs cross found Gil Neves who went close and Cabral‚Äôs swerving shot sailed away from the top corner, but the deadlock was broken in the 38th minute when Neves fired a left-footed effort past M√°rk Balogh. Cabral got on the score sheet in the 60th minute when he raced onto Rafael Quintas‚Äô pass, drew Balogh out of his box, stepped inside and curled the ball into the bottom corner. Benj√°min G√≥lik rattled the bar with Hungary's first shot of the match but there was no hint of a comeback in Braga. Jo√£o Arag√£o came off the bench and had an impact, hitting the post and testing Balogh. Bino Ma√ßaes‚Äô side take top spot in Group A4 where the winners qualify for the 2025 UEFA European U17 Championship in Albania. Serbia beat Netherlands 1-0 in Guimar√£es. Portugal face Netherlands in Vizela and Serbia in Barcelos.
